title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4210.2 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 4210.2 - Definitions

State Regulations
(a) Corporation
shall mean the New York State Urban Development Corporation, a public benefit
corporation created by chapter 174 of the Laws of 1968, as amended. (b) Industrial firm shall mean a
manufacturing firm involved with extracting, smelting, recovering, developing, preparing, compounding, converting, assembling or producing, in any manner, minerals, raw materials, products or substances of any kind or nature, and
shall include facilities related thereto for storage, warehousing or
distribution, for research and development or for the discovery of new, and the
refinement of known, substances, processes, and products. (c) Program shall mean the Small- and

Medium-Sized Business Assistance Program created by section 5-a of the Omnibus

Economic Development Act of 1987, chapter 839 of the Laws of 1987. (d) Project loans shall mean loans made to
businesses pursuant to the program. (e) Small- and medium-sized business
assistance project shall mean a project designed and intended for the purpose
of providing assistance to industrial firms that employ 500 or fewer employees
within the State on a full-time basis. (f) State shall mean the State of New

York. (g) UDC Act shall mean chapter
174 of the Laws of 1968, as amended. Notes

4210.2

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
